text: right North Gaulton Castle is a sea stack off the western coast off the Orkney main island. It is formed from the red sandstone of the area and is about 165 feet high. It was climbed in 2017 by four climbers using a Tyrolean traverse. ==References== Category:Climbing areas of Scotland Category:Landforms of Orkney Category:Stacks of Scotland Category:Tourist attractions in Orkney
title: North Gaulton Castle
